dialogue_turns.speaker: Narrator
dialogue_turns.text: In a London prison, the legal saga surrounding Julian Assange takes another turn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: In a London prison, the legal saga surrounding Julian Assange takes another turn.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Swedish prosecutors have just announced they're reopening that rape investigation against Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Swedish prosecutors have just announced they're reopening that rape investigation against Julian Assange.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sweden is reopening an investigation into allegations of rape against Wikileaks founder Julian Assange.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and this is, uh, coming after his lawyer for the alleged victim requested it back in early April.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and this is, uh, coming after his lawyer for the alleged victim requested it back in early April.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The announcement landed Monday, after the lawyer for the alleged victim requested in early April the Swedish Prosecution Authority look into the case again.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild—this case was first brought up in 2010, and he's always denied it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild-this case was first brought up in twenty ten, and he's always denied it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange, who denies the rape allegations first made in 2010, has faced numerous legal actions over the last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and now he's already serving 50 weeks for breaking bail after leaving the Ecuadorian embassy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and now he's already serving fifty weeks for breaking bail after leaving the Ecuadorian embassy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Having spent seven years in the Ecuadorian embassy in London, where he'd taken asylum to avoid extradition to Sweden, Assange was sentenced to 50 weeks for breaking his bail conditions at the start of May.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And don't forget the U.S. indictment too—conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack a military password.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And don't forget the U.S. indictment too-conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack a military password.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was also indicted by the U.S. government over an alleged conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack the password of a military computer in order to steal sensitive files.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So Sweden dropped the case in 2017 because they couldn't get to him, right? He was holed up in that embassy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Sweden dropped the case in twenty seventeen because they couldn't get to him, right? He was holed up in that embassy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Swedish prosecutors had initially dropped the case in 2017, after deciding they'd exhausted all possible avenues to properly investigate the allegations. That Assange had refused to cooperate was one significant factor in the case being suspended, the prosecutor's office said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But now that he's actually in custody in London, things have changed.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But now that he's actually in custody in London, things have changed.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: The prosecutor, Marianne Ny, had said back then it could reopen if he returned to Sweden by 2020.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The prosecutor, Marianne Ny, had said back then it could reopen if he returned to Sweden by twenty twenty.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But if Julian Assange was to return to Sweden in August 2020, the preliminary investigation could be reopened, director of public prosecution, Marianne Ny, said at the time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And now they're issuing an international arrest warrant. But he could also face extradition to the U.S.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And now they're issuing an international arrest warrant. But he could also face extradition to the U.S.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Swedish prosecutor will issue a European arrest warrant. With Assange now out of the embassy and in a London prison, he could now face extradition to Sweden or the U.S.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, those hearings have already started, but they're gonna take months.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, those hearings have already started, but they're gonna take months.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hearings into his possible extradition to America have begun, but will likely take months to conclude.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So U.K. authorities will have to decide which request gets priority—Sweden's or America's.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So U.K. authorities will have to decide which request gets priority-Sweden's or America's.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In the event of a conflict between a European arrest warrant and a request for extradition from the U.S., U.K. authorities will decide on the order of priority.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Deputy prosecutor Eva-Marie Persson said the outcome is impossible to predict, but she thinks the Swedish case can proceed at the same time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Deputy prosecutor Eva-Marie Persson said the outcome is impossible to predict, but she thinks the Swedish case can proceed at the same time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The outcome of this process is impossible to predict, said deputy director of public prosecution Eva-Marie Persson. However, in my view the Swedish case can proceed concurrently with the proceedings in the U.K.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They want to interview him in the U.K., but he has to agree to cooperate.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They want to interview him in the U.K., but he has to agree to cooperate.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Persson said investigators will ask for an interview with Assange in the U.K., but noted it would require the Wikileaks founder to cooperate.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which, given his history, uh, doesn't seem super likely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, given his history, uh, doesn't seem super likely.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: His legal team wasn't available for comment, so we'll have to wait and see how this unfolds.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: His legal team wasn't available for comment, so we'll have to wait and see how this unfolds.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Assange's legal team couldn't be reached for comment at the time of publication.

artist_script:
In a London prison, the legal saga surrounding Julian Assange takes another turn.
HostA: Swedish prosecutors have just announced they're reopening that rape investigation against Julian Assange.
HostB: Right, and this is, uh, coming after his lawyer for the alleged victim requested it back in early April.
HostA: It's wild—this case was first brought up in 2010, and he's always denied it.
HostB: Yeah, and now he's already serving 50 weeks for breaking bail after leaving the Ecuadorian embassy.
HostA: And don’t forget the U.S. indictment too—conspiracy with Chelsea Manning to crack a military password.
HostB: So Sweden dropped the case in 2017 because they couldn't get to him, right? He was holed up in that embassy.
HostA: Exactly. But now that he's actually in custody in London, things have changed.
HostB: The prosecutor, Marianne Ny, had said back then it could reopen if he returned to Sweden by 2020.
HostA: And now they're issuing an international arrest warrant. But he could also face extradition to the U.S.
HostB: Yeah, those hearings have already started, but they’re gonna take months.
HostA: So U.K. authorities will have to decide which request gets priority—Sweden's or America's.
HostB: Deputy prosecutor Eva-Marie Persson said the outcome is impossible to predict, but she thinks the Swedish case can proceed at the same time.
HostA: They want to interview him in the U.K., but he has to agree to cooperate.
HostB: Which, given his history, uh, doesn't seem super likely.
HostA: His legal team wasn't available for comment, so we'll have to wait and see how this unfolds.
